title: Binary Tree Maximum Path Sum
statement: Return the maximum sum of any path in a binary tree.
example_explanation: The path 15 → 20 → 7 gives the maximum sum.

title: All Nodes Distance K in Binary Tree
statement: Find all nodes that are distance K from a given target node.
example_explanation: These nodes are exactly 2 edges away from the target.

title: Binary Tree Right Side View
statement: Return the values of the nodes visible from the right side.
example_explanation: The rightmost node at each level is visible.

title: Diameter of Binary Tree
statement: Return the length of the longest path between any two nodes.

title: Lowest Common Ancestor of a Binary Tree
statement: Find the lowest common ancestor of two nodes in a binary tree.
example_explanation: Node 3 is the lowest node that has both 5 and 1 as descendants.

title: Validate Binary Search Tree
statement: Determine if a binary tree is a valid binary search tree.
example_explanation: The tree satisfies BST ordering constraints.

title: Convert Sorted Array to Binary Search Tree
statement: Convert a sorted array into a height-balanced BST.
example_explanation: Middle elements are chosen to keep the tree balanced.

title: Sum of Left Leaves
statement: Return the sum of all left leaf nodes.
